definitions.definition: either of the two long parts of the upper body that are attached to the shoulders and have the hands at the end:
examples: My arms ache from carrying this bag.

definitions.definition: The arm of a piece of clothing or furniture is a part of it that you put your arm in or on:
When two people are arm in arm, they both have one arm bent at the elbow and passing around and supporting, or being supported by, the arm of the other person:
examples: We walked arm in arm along the river bank.

definitions.definition: to provide yourself or others with a weapon or weapons:
examples: Nobody knows who is arming the terrorists.

definitions.definition: to provide yourself or others with equipment or knowledge in order to complete a particular task:
examples: She armed herself for the interview by finding out all she could about the company in advance.
